page.title: 05PRIMARY EDUCATION STEWARTON
page.content: There are two primary schools in the area and six playgroups for under school age children.Nether Robertland Primary in Pokelly Place,opened in 1973,is a semi open plan school with 374 pupils from the town and surrounding countryside. The headteacher is Mrs Jessie Hunter and there are 14 full time teachers and 6 visiting teachers.Serving the other part of the town is Lainshaw Primary which has 4 separate buildings,the oldest of which was built in 1876.Next year,hopefully,in June 1986 the school should be housed in the refurbished former secondary school in Kilwinning Road. The headteacher is Miss Aileen McKinnon and her 365 pupils are taught by 14 teachers and 5 visiting ones.Both schools are up to date in methods and curriculum.
